intro: Pedicularis recutita var. trichocalycina, commonly known as the hairy calyx lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate and often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The variety trichocalycina is distinguished by its hairy calyces, which contribute to its common name.
